title: Theresa May says Tories are 'only party that represents every part of the UK'
text:
1 of 8 'I will be ruthless in cutting out waste, streamlining structures and improving efficiency' 
Announcing she would trigger Article 50 in the next two weeks she said: “We stand on the threshold of one of the most significant moments Britain has known for many years. 
“In such moments we have a choice - we can look froward with hope or give in to the politics of despair. 
“While the road ay be uncertain at times, I believe it leads to a brighter future for our nation’s children.” SKY Theresa May and Nicola Sturgeon have clashed over the SNP's independence bid 
Reflecting on the EU referendum result from June 23 last year, she claimed it was not just a vote to leave the European Union but an instruction to change the way our country works – and the people for whom it works – forever. 
Mrs May added: “We will get the right deal for Britain abroad – forging a new partnership with our friends and allies in Europe, but looking beyond Europe to build relationships with old friends and new allies around the world too.” 
She also promised that Brexit will bring a fairer society and stronger economy as well as “a more united nation”. SKY Mrs May made it clear that now is time for the “country to come together” 
The national tour comes after the determined PM rejected the “divisive politics” and “game playing” of Nicola Sturgeon and the SNP. 
She also rejected their demand for a referendum between Autumn 2018 and Spring 2019 - before Britain has concluded Brexit negotiations. 
The Tory leader branded Ms Sturgeon’s to turn Scot against Scot in a rerun of bitter 2014 independence referendum as “unfair” - warning that “now is not the right time” to revisit Scotland’s place in the UK. 
However she suggested she could be open to another vote once Brexit is settled, but indicated Scotland would have to wait six years. Related articles
